headline: JPMorgan Expands Apple Card Role And Payments Data As Valuation Lags Targets
summary: JPMorgan Chase is set to replace Goldman Sachs as the issuer of Apple’s Apple Card, adding more than 12 million cardholders to its consumer franchise. The bank is expanding its role in digital payments through Kinexys Liink, which has integrated with Nacha’s Phixius network for real time, multi source validation of U.S. account data in cross border transactions. For investors watching NYSE:JPM, these developments come with the stock recently trading around $322.1 and a reported 1 year...
